intro: Pleurogyne bodinieri, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories.
